# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session

#importing essential libraries
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import warnings
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.io as pio
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")
source.6099e954:
df["powerstats__intelligence"]= df["powerstats__intelligence"].fillna(df["powerstats__intelligence"].mean())
df["powerstats__strength"]= df["powerstats__strength"].fillna(df["powerstats__strength"].mean())
df["powerstats__speed"]= df["powerstats__speed"].fillna(df["powerstats__speed"].mean())
df["powerstats__durability"]= df["powerstats__durability"].fillna(df["powerstats__durability"].mean())
df["powerstats__power"]= df["powerstats__power"].fillna(df["powerstats__power"].mean())
df["powerstats__combat"]= df["powerstats__combat"].fillna(df["powerstats__combat"].mean())
df["biography__publisher"]= df["biography__publisher"].fillna(df["biography__publisher"].mode())
source.83bfb8af:
df["height"]=df["height"].apply(lambda x: str(x).replace("'","."))
df["height"]=df["height"].apply(lambda x: float(x))
source.631ebf34:
df["weight"]= df["weight"].apply(lambda x:str(x).replace(" lb",""))
df["weight"]= df["weight"].apply(lambda x:int(x))
source.128f442a:
x= df.loc[(df.alignment== "good") | (df.alignment== "neutral")]
x= x.groupby("name").Overall.mean().sort_values(ascending= False).head(10).to_frame().reset_index()
ax= px.bar(x,x= "Overall",y= "name",color= "Overall",template="plotly_dark",title= "TOP SUPERHEROES")
ax.show()
source.1412b450:
x= df.loc[(df.alignment== "bad")]
x= x.groupby("name").Overall.mean().sort_values(ascending= False).head(10).to_frame().reset_index()
ax= px.bar(x,x= "name",y= "Overall",color= "Overall",template="plotly_dark",title= "TOP SUPERVILLIANS")
ax.show()
source.871da407:
x= df.loc[(df.alignment== "bad") & (df.gender== "Female")]
x= x.groupby("name").Overall.mean().sort_values(ascending= False).head(10).to_frame().reset_index()
ax= px.bar(x,x= "Overall",y= "name",color= "name",template="plotly_dark",title= "TOP FEMALE SUPERVILLIANS")
ax.show()

source.b44a869b: Superheroes come from a wide array of different backgrounds and origins. Some superheroes (for example, Batman and Iron Man) derive their status from advanced technology they create and use, while others (such as Superman and Spider-Man) possess non-human or superhuman biology or study and practice magic to achieve their abilities (such as Zatanna and Doctor Strange)

source.b9d8e205: Some superheroes use their powers to help fight daily crime while also combating threats against humanity from supervillains, who are their criminal counterparts. Often at least one of these supervillains will be the superhero's archenemy. Some popular supervillains become recurring characters in their own right; and long-running superheroes and superheroines such as Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, Spider-Man, Captain America, and Iron Man have a rogues gallery of many such villains.

source.0ef97682:
-68.5% of the characters in the dataset are male while around 27% of characters are females

-Around 67% of the characters align towards the good side and can be considered as truly superheroes while 28% of the characters align towards bad (villians) 

-Man of miracles and One-above-all have the highest overall stats and can be considered most powerfull

-General Zod is the most powerful super villian followed by superboy-prime and steppenwolf


-Big barda is most powerfull female supervillian followed by Faora

-Marvel and dc comics are most popular pulishers

-X men ,avengers and justice league are notable groups

-There are 38 characters with highest intelligence of 100 and can be considered as smartest

-There are 30 characters that have been rated highest for speed

-the ymir is the tallest character standing at 1000 ft

-Godzilla is the heaviest character of all time
